WorkItem.Description:
I am receiving this error when i try to bind the header of a column.
 
System.Windows.Data Error: 39 : BindingExpression path error: 'TKM03' property not found on 'object' ''TextBlock' (Name='')'. BindingExpression:Path=TKM03.NomeUsuario; DataItem='TextBlock' (Name=''); target element is 'TextBlock' (Name=''); target property is 'Text' (type 'String')
 
My xaml:
 
                   <dg:DataGrid ItemsSource="{Binding Path=TKM03.ObjetoLista, Mode=TwoWay}" Grid.Row="2" Grid.ColumnSpan="4"
                                 BorderThickness="1,1,1,0" BorderBrush="Black" HeadersVisibility="Column" HorizontalScrollBarVisibility="Disabled"
                                 AutoGenerateColumns="False" RowHeight="18" CanUserAddRows="False" IsReadOnly="True" >
                        <dg:DataGrid.Columns>
 
                            <dg:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Path=Atividade}"  Width="340" >
                                <dg:DataGridTextColumn.Header>
                                    <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=TKM03.NomeUsuario, Mode=TwoWay}" />
                                </dg:DataGridTextColumn.Header>
                            </dg:DataGridTextColumn>
                            
                            <dg:DataGridTextColumn Binding="{Binding Path=Quantidade}" Header="Quantidade" Width="80" />
                        </dg:DataGrid.Columns>
                    </dg:DataGrid>
 
I don't know what is going on. My workaround was give a name for the textblock and bind it inside cs, but is not so good.
 
PS.: Binding the column is perfect, no problem. I have already tested the same property (TKM03.NomeUsuario) and it bind outside the grid, like 
<TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=TKM03.NomeUsuario, Mode=TwoWay}" />
 
Thanks,
Carlos

Comments.Message:
We have filed a bug in our internal database to be fixed in a future release.

The issue is that Bindings rely on the DataContext to inherit to the object on which it is set. This works naturally for elements in a visual tree and through special work for a few properties. The Columns collection needs this work done in order for Bindings like the one you specified to work.
